main.name: Arham Arshad
main.description: HELLO, WORLD! I'M A DEVELOPER & DESIGNER
main.bio: Hi I'm Arham (he/him), a computer science student, studying at Dalhousie University located on the East coast of Canada. Currently I'm working on side projects related to programming and web development, conducting statistical anlaysis and always looking for a new challenge to complete! I want to keep learning and improving both my interpersonal and technical skills so that I can strive to be the most successful version of myself.

education.description:
So far in my degree, I've learned concepts in Software Development,
Programming, Interdisciplinary Management and Micro-Organizational Behaviour

work.title: Research Analyst Intern
work.description:
Conducted extensive research on Agile software development predicting correlations between exogenous and endogenous variables using mathematical regression models in R.
 Brought forth a strong understanding of research methods and data analysis by performing case meta-analysis and statistical analysis on Scrum case studies.
 
 Documented a research paper for publishing detailing the entire project.
 Organized and prioritized work to complete tasks in timely, efficient manner.

work.title: Teaching Assistant
work.description:
Assisted professor with conducting tutorials and labs while also aiding students with their assignments and labs focusing on HTML, CSS and JavaScript.
 Graded labs and assignments along with providing weekly discussions with students.
 Worked with students individually and provided extra support at the facultyâ€™s Learning Center.
 Other Duties include grading weekly quizzes, workbooks, essays and term project reports.

projects.title: PictureGram
projects.category: A content management system similar to that of Instagram
